contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Wiktionary|trimeter}} In [[poetry]], a '''trimeter''' is a metre of three [[metrical foot|metrical feet]] per line—example: : When here // the spring // we see, : Fresh green // upon // the tree. (Greek "three measure"): a line with three stresses. Coleridge, Christabel, line 31: "She stole along, she nothing spoke." <ref>{{cite book|title=The Norton Anthology of English Literature|year=2006|publisher=Norton|location= United States|isbn=0-393-92713-X (v. 1)|pages=A62}}</ref> ==See also== * [[Anapaest]] * [[Dactyl (poetry)|Dactyl]] == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Poetic rhythm]] {{Poetry-stub}}
